markdownRemark.html: I added a tooltip for my social links. I use jQuery to set the tooltip. jQuery is an amazing framework that make my work more efficient.

prev.html:
Because Jekyll doesn't fully support tagging feature. I learned how to feature tags into my blogs. I found several ways. Fianlly I made it work by following the guides given by MIDDUST. This method need no plugin but you have to generate a separate page everytime you create a new tag. So it's like a work-around method.

Here are other methods may help:

  • Tags In Jekyll by Charlie Park(using Rugy plugin)
  • A method similar to MIDDUST
  • A method using JSON

next.html: Today I tried to figure out how to use some pretty icon to show my contact at footer. Then I found Font-awesome. It has a vast variety of useful website icons which is designed for Bootstrap. It is controlled by CSS that can create many amazing effects. It satifies all I need and make my site look nicer.
